content: <?xml version="1.0" encoding="ISO-8859-1"?> <metadata> <idinfo> <citation> <citeinfo> <origin>U.S. Geological Survey (USGS) <http://www.usgs.gov/>, Coastal and Marine Geology Program (CMGP) <http://marine.usgs.gov/></origin> <pubdate>20131029</pubdate> <title> Geophysical data of field activity 69002 (K-0-69-GM) in Gulf Mexico North from 01/17/1969 to 01/29/1969 </title> <pubinfo> <pubplace>Menlo Park, CA</pubplace> <publish>U.S. Geological Survey (USGS) <http://www.usgs.gov>, Coastal and Marine Geology (CMG) <http://walrus.wr.usgs.gov></publish> </pubinfo> <onlink>http://walrus.wr.usgs.gov/infobank/gos/k-0-69-gm.fmeta.xml</onlink> <onlink>http://walrus.wr.usgs.gov/infobank/k/k069gm/html/k-0-69-gm.meta.html</onlink> <onlink>http://quashnet.er.usgs.gov/data/1969/69002/index.html</onlink> </citeinfo> </citation> <descript> <abstract> United States Navy,United States Geological Survey, Menlo Park, California. Chief Scientists: Louis Garrison, Robert H. Fedden. Geophysical data (sparker, magnetics, LoranA, navigation, sextant, LoranC, 3dot5khz, tempsalinometer, radar) of field activity 69002 (K-0-69-GM) in Gulf Mexico North from 01/17/1969 to 01/29/1969, http://walrus.wr.usgs.gov/infobank/k/k069gm/html/k-0-69-gm.meta.html. </abstract> <purpose> These data and information are intended for science researchers, students from elementary through college, policy makers, and general public. </purpose> <supplinf>  Equipment Used -  sparker                       Seismic Section Profiler (SSP) with 66-m long hydrostreamers consisting of 100 piezoelectric hydrophones  magnetics                     surface proton magnetometer  LoranA  navigation                    Omega  sextant  LoranC  3dot5khz                      EDO-Western model 240 A with a hull-mounted piezoelectric transducer  tempsalinometer  radar  Notes -  This was the shakedown cruise, Leg A, of Phase 1.  Publications -  Garrison, Louis E. and Martin, Ray G., Jr., 1973, Geologic structures  in the Gulf of Mexico Basin. U.S. Geological Survey Professional Paper  773, 85 p.  Similar information is available for thousands of other USGS/CMG-related Activities.  If known, available are Activity-specific navigation, gravity, magnetics, bathymetry, seismic, and sampling data; track maps; and equipment information; as well as summary overviews, crew lists, and information about analog materials.  If available, access to physical samples is described in the "WR CMG Sample Distribution Policy" at: http://walrus.wr.usgs.gov/infobank/programs/html/main/sample-dist-policy.html  Primary access to the USGS/CMG Information Bank's digital data, analog data, and metadata is provided through... http://walrus.wr.usgs.gov/infobank/  This page accomodates a variety of search approaches (e.g., by platform, by region, by scientist, by equipment type, etc.). </supplinf> </descript> <timeperd> <timeinfo> <rngdates> <begdate>19690117</begdate> <enddate>19690129</enddate> </rngdates> </timeinfo> <current>ground condition</current> </timeperd> <status> <progress>Complete</progress> <update>As needed</update> </status> <spdom> <bounding> <westbc>-96.36667</westbc> <eastbc>-81.76666</eastbc> <northbc>28.38333</northbc> <southbc>23.93333</southbc> </bounding> </spdom> <keywords> <theme> <themekt>ISO 19115 Topic Category</themekt> <themekey>geoscientificinformation</themekey> <themekey>oceans</themekey> </theme> <theme> <themekt>Global Change Master Directory (GCMD)</themekt> <themekey>EARTH SCIENCE > OCEANS</themekey> </theme> <theme> <themekt>USGS CMG InfoBank</themekt> <themekey>Marine Geology</themekey> <themekey>Bathymetry</themekey> <themekey>Water Depth</themekey> <themekey>Seafloor Topography</themekey> </theme> <place> <placekt>USGS CMG InfoBank</placekt> <placekey>Gulf Coast</placekey> <placekey>Gulf Coast, US</placekey> <placekey>Gulf Mexico North</placekey> <placekey>Gulf of Mexico</placekey> <placekey>USA</placekey> </place> </keywords> <accconst> Physical materials are under controlled on-site access.
